quotes.quote: The radiance of the new world came into being bathed in nectar, bathed in love.
quotes.speaker: Preah Khan Inscription

quotes.quote: The caged bird watches butterflies with envy.
quotes.speaker: Kobayashi Issa

quotes.quote: He heard these horrors and his spirit stirred, and spurred to action, he sheathed his skin in burnished bronze.
quotes.speaker: The Iliad

quotes.quote: When I was young I thought that money was the most important thing in life; now that I am old I know that it is.
quotes.speaker: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: Perfection is achieved not when there is nothing more to add, but when there is nothing left to take away.
quotes.speaker: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

quotes.quote: Iron made this promise: 'By the tongs and the hammer, many trees I can injure, but I shall not kill the best of heroes.
quotes.speaker: The Kalevala

quotes.quote: The essence of all beings is the earth; the earth, water; the water, plants; plants, man; and man, speech.
quotes.speaker: The Upanishads

quotes.quote: He was the first to construct a wall, eighty miles in length, which was to separate the barbarians from the Romans.
quotes.speaker: Cassius Dio

quotes.quote: There is geometry in the humming of the strings. There is music in the spacing of the spheres.
quotes.speaker: Pythagoras

quotes.quote: Ships at a distance have every man's wish on board.
quotes.speaker: Zora Neale Hurston

quotes.quote: The fair breeze blew, the white foam flew, the furrow followed free; we were the first that ever burst into that silent sea.
quotes.speaker: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quotes.quote: Even a great carpenter does not abandon his string.
quotes.speaker: Mencius

quotes.quote: The spoken word conquers all thought, but the written word commands it.
quotes.speaker: Walter Benjamin
